articles.headline: In India, Wal-Mart Goes to the Farm
articles.snippet: Establishing good relations with farmers is a centerpiece of Wal-Mart’s expansion strategy.
articles.abstract: Establishing good relations with farmers is a centerpiece of Wal-Mart’s expansion strategy.
articles.lead_paragraph: HAIDER NAGAR, India — At first glance, the vegetable patches in this north Indian village look no different from the many small, spare farms that dot the country.

articles.headline: China Pledges to Work With U.S. on Iran Sanctions
articles.snippet: President Hu Jintao agreed to join negotiations on sanctions against Iran, but he made no specific commitment to U.S.-backed measures, officials said.
articles.abstract: President Hu Jintao agreed to join negotiations on sanctions against Iran, but he made no specific commitment to U.S.-backed measures, officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama secured a promise from President Hu Jintao of China on Monday to join negotiations on a new package of sanctions against Iran, administration officials said, but Mr. Hu made no specific commitment to backing measures that the United States considers severe enough to force a change in direction in Iran’s nuclear program.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and Mark Landler

articles.headline: O’Brien Will Move to TBS
articles.snippet: Conan O’Brien, who had been expected to sign a deal with Fox, has agreed to join TBS’s late-night lineup after negotiations that began just days ago.
articles.abstract: Conan O’Brien, who had been expected to sign a deal with Fox, has agreed to join TBS’s late-night lineup after negotiations that began just days ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: EUGENE, Ore. — In a move that has shocked much of the television world, Conan O’Brien will make his comeback on a cable — not a network — channel.

articles.headline: Imagine the Bailouts Are Working
articles.snippet: The Treasury will probably earn a profit on Citigroup and could break even on A.I.G.
articles.abstract: The Treasury will probably earn a profit on Citigroup and could break even on A.I.G.
articles.lead_paragraph: What if, after all that panting over Washington’s bailout of the financial system, we learned that it actually worked?

articles.headline: Lehman Channeled Risks Through ‘Alter Ego’ Firm
articles.snippet: Before its collapse, Lehman Brothers shifted investments off its books by using a company whose board it controlled.
articles.abstract: Before its collapse, Lehman Brothers shifted investments off its books by using a company whose board it controlled.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was like a hidden passage on Wall Street, a secret channel that enabled billions of dollars to flow through Lehman Brothers.
articles.byline: By Louise Story and Eric Dash

articles.headline: Leg Lost, Dancer Is Caught Between Caregivers
articles.snippet: A battle over helping a dancer who lost a leg in Haiti’s earthquake highlights Haitians’ dependence on international charity.
articles.abstract: A battle over helping a dancer who lost a leg in Haiti’s earthquake highlights Haitians’ dependence on international charity.
articles.lead_paragraph: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti — Fabienne Jean, a professional dancer who lost her right leg in the earthquake, hopped on her slim left leg through the dusty General Hospital compound on her way to a very important X-ray.

articles.headline: Twitter Unveils Plans to Draw Money From Ads
articles.snippet: The microblogging service plans to link keyword searches with advertising and show users relevant promoted posts.
articles.abstract: The microblogging service plans to link keyword searches with advertising and show users relevant promoted posts.
articles.lead_paragraph: Twitter will unveil on Tuesday a much-anticipated plan for making money from advertising, finally answering the question of how the company expects to turn its exponential growth into revenue.

articles.headline: Obama Vows Fresh Proliferation Push as Summit Ends
articles.snippet: Leaders at a 47-nation nuclear security conference agreed to secure or destroy hundreds of thousands of tons of weapons-grade nuclear fuel by 2014.
articles.abstract: Leaders at a 47-nation nuclear security conference agreed to secure or destroy hundreds of thousands of tons of weapons-grade nuclear fuel by 2014.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama completed a first meeting of world leaders on combating nuclear terrorism with a list of specific commitments from dozens of nations to eliminate or lock down nuclear materials, in what he called a “bold and pragmatic” program to finish the task in the next four years.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Takes Aim at Plans to Curb Finance Industry
articles.snippet: Senator Mitch McConnell and Republicans criticized a bill as arrogant, but Democrats accused Republicans of trying to prevent tougher policing of Wall Street.
articles.abstract: Senator Mitch McConnell and Republicans criticized a bill as arrogant, but Democrats accused Republicans of trying to prevent tougher policing of Wall Street.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Drawing the lines for a fierce election-year battle over regulating the nation’s financial system, Senate Republicans on Tuesday insisted that legislation proposed by Democrats and the White House would only encourage future taxpayer bailouts of big banks.
articles.byline: By David M. Herszenhorn and Sewell Chan
